info.title: Memobase API
info.summary: APIs for Memobase, a user memory system for LLM Apps

get.description: Check if your memobase is set up correctly

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase

from memobase import MemoBaseClient

memobase = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')

assert memobase.ping()
x-code-samples.label: Python
JavaScript
Go

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase

from memobase import MemoBaseClient

memobase = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')

config = memobase.get_config()
x-code-samples.label: Python
JavaScript
Go

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase

from memobase import MemoBaseClient

memobase = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')

users = memobase.get_all_users(search="", order_by="updated_at", order_desc=True, limit=10, offset=0)

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase

from memobase import MemoBaseClient
from memobase.core.blob import BlobType

client = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')

user = client.get_user('user_id')
blobs = user.get_all(BlobType.chat)

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase

from memobase import MemoBaseClient
from memobase.core.blob import ChatBlob

client = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')

b = ChatBlob(messages=[
    {
        "role": "user",
        "content": "Hi, I'm here again"
    },
    {
        "role": "assistant",
        "content": "Hi, Gus! How can I help you?"
    }
])
u = client.get_user(uid)
bid = u.insert(b)
x-code-samples.label: Python
JavaScript
Go

get.description: Get the real-time user profiles for long term memory

parameters.name: user_id

schema.description: The ID of the user to get profiles for
schema.title: User Id

parameters.description: The ID of the user to get profiles for

parameters.name: topk

schema.description: Number of profiles to retrieve, default is all
schema.title: Topk

parameters.description: Number of profiles to retrieve, default is all

parameters.name: max_token_size

schema.description: Max token size of returned profile content, default is all
schema.title: Max Token Size

parameters.description: Max token size of returned profile content, default is all

parameters.name: prefer_topics

schema.description: Rank prefer topics at first to try to keep them in filtering, default order is by updated time
schema.title: Prefer Topics

parameters.description: Rank prefer topics at first to try to keep them in filtering, default order is by updated time

parameters.name: only_topics

schema.description: Only return profiles with these topics, default is all
schema.title: Only Topics

parameters.description: Only return profiles with these topics, default is all

parameters.name: max_subtopic_size

schema.description: Max subtopic size of the same topic in returned profile, default is all
schema.title: Max Subtopic Size

parameters.description: Max subtopic size of the same topic in returned profile, default is all

parameters.name: topic_limits_json

schema.description: Set specific subtopic limits for topics in JSON, for example {"topic1": 3, "topic2": 5}. The limits in this param will override `max_subtopic_size`.
schema.title: Topic Limits Json

parameters.description: Set specific subtopic limits for topics in JSON, for example {"topic1": 3, "topic2": 5}. The limits in this param will override `max_subtopic_size`.

parameters.name: chats_str

schema.description: List of chats in OpenAI Message format, for example: [{"role": "user", "content": "Hello"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Hi"}]
schema.title: Chats Str

parameters.description: List of chats in OpenAI Message format, for example: [{"role": "user", "content": "Hello"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Hi"}]

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase

from memobase import MemoBaseClient

client = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')
uid = client.add_user()
u = client.get_user(uid)
# ... insert messages to user

events = u.event(topk=5)
eid = events[0].id

u.update_event(eid, {"event_tip": "The event is about..."})
print(u.event(topk=1))

Go

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase

from memobase import MemoBaseClient

client = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')
uid = client.add_user()
u = client.get_user(uid)
# ... insert messages to user

events = u.event(topk=1)
print(events)

eid = events[0].id
u.delete_event(eid)

print(u.event(topk=1))

Go

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase

from memobase import MemoBaseClient
from memobase.core.blob import ChatBlob

client = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')
uid = client.add_user()
u = client.get_user(uid)

b = ChatBlob(messages=[
    {
        "role": "user",
        "content": "Hi, I'm here again"
    },
    {
        "role": "assistant",
        "content": "Hi, Gus! How can I help you?"
    }
])
u.insert(b)
u.flush(sync=True)

events = u.search_event('query')
print(events)
x-code-samples.label: Python
Go

x-code-samples.source:
# To use the Python SDK, install the package:
# pip install memobase
from memobase import MemoBaseClient
from memobase.core.blob import ChatBlob

client = MemoBaseClient(project_url='PROJECT_URL', api_key='PROJECT_TOKEN')
uid = client.add_user()
u = client.get_user(uid)

b = ChatBlob(messages=[
    {
        "role": "user",
        "content": "Hi, I'm here again"
    },
    {
        "role": "assistant",
        "content": "Hi, Gus! How can I help you?"
    }
])
u.insert(b)
u.flush(sync=True)

events = u.search_event_gist('query')
print(events)

schema.title: Max Token Size

parameters.name: prefer_topics

schema.description: Rank prefer topics at first to try to keep them in filtering, default order is by updated time
schema.title: Prefer Topics

parameters.description: Rank prefer topics at first to try to keep them in filtering, default order is by updated time

parameters.name: only_topics

schema.description: Only return profiles with these topics, default is all
schema.title: Only Topics

parameters.description: Only return profiles with these topics, default is all

parameters.name: max_subtopic_size

schema.description: Max subtopic size of the same topic in returned Context
schema.title: Max Subtopic Size

parameters.description: Max subtopic size of the same topic in returned Context

parameters.name: topic_limits_json

schema.description: Set specific subtopic limits for topics in JSON, for example {"topic1": 3, "topic2": 5}. The limits in this param will override `max_subtopic_size`.
schema.title: Topic Limits Json

parameters.description: Set specific subtopic limits for topics in JSON, for example {"topic1": 3, "topic2": 5}. The limits in this param will override `max_subtopic_size`.

parameters.name: profile_event_ratio

schema.description: Profile event ratio of returned Context
schema.title: Profile Event Ratio

parameters.description: Profile event ratio of returned Context

parameters.name: require_event_summary

schema.description: Whether to require event summary in returned Context
schema.title: Require Event Summary

parameters.description: Whether to require event summary in returned Context

parameters.name: chats_str

schema.description:
Pass the recent chats to enable context search. 
Memobase will use those chats to search for relevant events.
It's a list of chats in OpenAI Message format, for example: [{"role": "user", "content": "Hello"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Hi"}].

**NOTICE**
- It will increase your latency by 0.1-1 seconds, because Memobase will use Embedding to search for relevant profiles and events.
- It will cost your Memobase tokens, roughly 100~200 tokens per chat based on the profile size.
- The profiles in the context will not be searched by the `chats_str`.
- If you want also search profiles, see `full_profile_and_only_search_event` query parameter.
schema.title: Chats Str

parameters.description:
Pass the recent chats to enable context search. 
Memobase will use those chats to search for relevant events.
It's a list of chats in OpenAI Message format, for example: [{"role": "user", "content": "Hello"}, {"role": "assistant", "content": "Hi"}].

**NOTICE**
- It will increase your latency by 0.1-1 seconds, because Memobase will use Embedding to search for relevant profiles and events.
- It will cost your Memobase tokens, roughly 100~200 tokens per chat based on the profile size.
- The profiles in the context will not be searched by the `chats_str`.
- If you want also search profiles, see `full_profile_and_only_search_event` query parameter.

parameters.name: event_similarity_threshold

schema.description: Event similarity threshold of returned Context
schema.title: Event Similarity Threshold

parameters.description: Event similarity threshold of returned Context

parameters.name: time_range_in_days

schema.description: Only allow events within the past few days, default is 180
schema.title: Time Range In Days

parameters.description: Only allow events within the past few days, default is 180

parameters.name: customize_context_prompt

schema.description:
Customize context prompt template.
- use `{profile_section}` to refer to the profile section
- use `{event_section}` to refer to the event section

For example:
```
# Memory
Unless the user has relevant queries, do not actively mention those memories in the conversation.
## User Background:
{profile_section}

## Latest Events:
{event_section}
```
schema.title: Customize Context Prompt

parameters.description:
Customize context prompt template.
- use `{profile_section}` to refer to the profile section
- use `{event_section}` to refer to the event section

For example:
```
# Memory
Unless the user has relevant queries, do not actively mention those memories in the conversation.
## User Background:
{profile_section}

## Latest Events:
{event_section}
```

parameters.name: full_profile_and_only_search_event

schema.description:
If you pass `chats_str` and set this to `False`, Memobase will search for relevant profiles and events at the same time.
**NOTICE**
- It will increase your latency by 2-5(based on the profile size) seconds, because Memobase will use LLM and Embedding to search for relevant profiles and events.
- It will cost your Memobase tokens, roughly 100~1000 tokens per chat based on the profile size.
schema.title: Full Profile And Only Search Event

parameters.description:
If you pass `chats_str` and set this to `False`, Memobase will search for relevant profiles and events at the same time.
**NOTICE**
- It will increase your latency by 2-5(based on the profile size) seconds, because Memobase will use LLM and Embedding to search for relevant profiles and events.
- It will cost your Memobase tokens, roughly 100~1000 tokens per chat based on the profile size.

parameters.name: fill_window_with_events

schema.description: If set to `True`, Memobase will fill the token window with the rest events.
schema.title: Fill Window With Events

parameters.description: If set to `True`, Memobase will fill the token window with the rest events.

context = u.context()
